intro: Calendula aestivalis, commonly known as the summer marigold, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to yellow ray flowers and dark green, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calendula aestivalis is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and has historical uses in herbal medicine.
